Entries.default: "You're a follower of the light?"
"The light? Oh, you mean... uh, well, depends on what you mean by 'follow.'"
"Maybe you heard earlier? I follow Eothas, too. Mostly. In a way."
"That's uh, that's good, I guess. For you."
"O-oh... maybe you don't want to talk about it? That's all right! Surely... some other time, then."
"When I was little, me and my brothers used to spend hours chasing each other through the murkberry fields."
"We did that sometimes. Only my brother usually had a hand in the bleeding."
"He older or younger than you? Either way, I bet he's just as strapping."
"Older. Was. Was older. Then Readceras invaded."
"Oh, I didn't... I mean, I... Of course, that's... Gaun, but I'm so sorry!"
"Ed√©r, I get the feeling you don't like me much. Was it something I said? I think it was something I said."
"No, it's not, uh... You're not doing anything wrong, exactly..."
"Really? I mean, you'd tell me... if you had a problem, right? If I'd bothered you this whole time..."
"It's nothing personal. I just don't think we need to be talking, is all."
"Oh. Well... thanks for clearing that up."
"Hey, I wanted to ask you something. It's about Xoti."
"Hey, uh, Xoti? Those dreams of yours, they still getting to you?"
"I can deal with the dreams, for better or worse. What makes me sweat is the not knowing..."
"Yeah. I've had thoughts like that for a long time. Except now I'm worried about what he intends for the world."
"Whatever it might be... at least we'll face it together."
"I know you were expecting different from Eothas. I was, too."
"I just thought for sure... I'd have my answers. Now, I don't know what to do."
"You'll figure something. Something'll feel right to you."
"Guess I might will then... Thanks."
"About Elafa... I'm sorry. She must've meant a real lot to you."
"More than I knew. Less than she deserved. But that's all past now."
"For a moment there, I thought her son might've been mine."
"It's a shame he wasn't. You would've been good to him. Good for him, too."
"When I heard, I didn't think I was ready. Then I thought, maybe I was..."
"Oh, I'm right as rain. And I think it's best if you don't worry so much about me."
"Right. Well I'll, uh, I'll stop worrying then."
"Moths have been eating through all my good clothes lately. Just realized why."
"But anybody got that much faith in any god, let alone Eothas... I don't know how to talk to someone like that. Not these days."

"I get why she's like that. I was there once, long time back."

His eyelids flare with relived embarrassment.
"But it's 'cause of that, I can't see a way to respect it."
"She- she means well. I can see that. And she's spirited, and if I was still young, and didn't know the things I know, it'd be different."
"What did you want to ask?"
"Not right now."
"Maybe later, then."
"I'm no good at hiding it from her either. I don't see this getting better."
"If she can't deal with the truth, that's her problem, not yours."
"There's more to her than you're giving her credit for."
"Keep avoiding her. The less you talk to her, the better."
"You're going to have to pretend to respect her."
"Doesn't seem like she's any different than what she shows."
"All right, I'm not gonna hide it. Won't be pretty, though."
"Don't think she'll take well to that. But maybe that's for the best."
"Never been much of a liar. Folks tend to see through."
"You're a great liar. Your problem is you don't believe in yourself."
"She just needs to see respect one time. She'll drop it after that."
"Even if it's a bad lie, she'll go along with it because it's what she'd rather believe."
"All right, I'll do like you said. I don't think she'll believe me, but I'll do it."
"She's a Dawnstar but she doesn't worship Eothas, she worships Gaun."
"Same thing, really. That's just her trying to find a way to worship Eothas that makes sense to her."
"Guess that sounds familiar, now that you mention it."
"I mean... I am a Child of the Dawnstars even if firstly I'm a Gaunite."
"Was it the way I said it? Or maybe I'm in need of a washing?"
"Don't think a day went by I didn't have a skinned knee or bleeding elbow."
"What happens when I stand face to face with my god - and he reveals what he intends for me? What if it's not as I thought?"
"Darn! I don't know what happened - I'm usually faster than that. I swear."
"Why? It wouldn't happen to be on account of my lantern, would it?"
"I know you think it's funny but the moths are so big here."
"No one's that bad at Orlan Slap. And I've played against some real sorry folk."
"Maybe I'm just the sorriest of the lot."
"It's a divine light - meant to cut through the darkness. 'Course it's going to draw the biggest ones."
"If I collapse... just drag me on a rope."
"This why you always got dirt in your hair?"
"What? You mean the grave dirt?"
"Some of these fights we've been in, you've bailed me out more than once."
"You'd do the same for any of us."
"Don't tell, but I try harder for the ones I like better."
"You've done the same for me."
"Had to. You're down six copper to me in Orlan Slap."
"So your helping me means more."
"You're right. It's best if you avoid her."
"If that's the case, then you're just going to have to pretend to like her."
"Something tells me that ain't it."
"Some of my pants, wouldn't be polite to wear 'em in public anymore."
"I wonder if I took to worshipping Ondra, if she could make me forget what I just heard."
[Pick his pocket while he's distracted.]
